medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient reports intermittent episodes of RUQ pain for at least the past year, occurring every few weeks/months, typically post-prandial, lasting a few hours and self-resolving. Today, the pain recurred 30 minutes after eating, becoming constant and radiating to the back. She endorses subjective mild chills over the past day but reports no objective fevers or associated nausea or vomiting.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, depression/anxiety, insomnia, hyperlipidemia, hyperkalemia, GERD, hypothyroidism, low back pain, vertigo, anemia, and prior appendectomy and total abdominal hysterectomy (TAH).
